description:
If you need to “remote” in to a local PC while on vacation. there’s a new way to do it: the Windows App, which is replacing the Remote Desktop app within Windows.

Microsoft’s Remote Desktop app is one of the easier ways to remotely connect to a PC while you’re out and about, allowing you to access a PC remotely and even perform some basic file transfers. (Unfortunately, since the October 2024 Update for Windows 11, the app has had some issues.)

In September 2024, however, Microsoft began rounding up some of its connectivity services and putt
title: Microsoft’s Remote Desktop app is going away

description:
For years, Windows users have complained about “ads” touting Microsoft services, showing up in various places. Now the alarm bells should be seriously ringing: Microsoft has publicly disclosed plans for monstrous ads within Copilot, as well as a roadmap to what appears to be AI-driven advertising, too.

Last week, Microsoft’s advertising blog outlined what it called the “future of audience engagement.” And you already know what that is: AI. Microsoft believes that not only will generative AI provide a more natural interface for users to shop, but agents will assist them. It gets worse: Brands may even deploy their own agent AI, too.

“We are committed to helping brands create agents and making it easy to connect them to our audiences,” Microsoft
title: Giant, AI ads are coming to Windows Copilot. Thanks, Microsoft

description:
One thing that you should always have at home is a trusty microSD card that you can use with your smartphone, tablet, action camera, drone, or handheld gaming console. If you don’t already have one (or want an extra), this 1TB Lexar Play is only $71 right now on Amazon, a cool 45% off its original $130 MSRP.

This microSD card doesn’t just have a ton of space for all your games, videos, music, apps, and files, but it’s also speedy. With up to 160 MB/s read speeds, you’ll be able to quickly load games and apps. It can also reach up to 100 MB/s write speeds, so you’ll be able to quickly transfer files from one device to another, save game data, and record video. In fact, it’s fast enough to record 4K video without frame drops.
title: Lexar’s spacious 1TB microSD card is a bargain now that it’s 45% off

description:
It’s been more than two years since Apple pulled the switch on an all-new architecture for its smart home app, but there are still plenty of users who are hanging onto the old Home infrastructure, either to maintain compatibility with older devices or for fear of a bumpy transition. 

Now comes word that upcoming version of iOS may force Apple users to switch to the new Home architecture, like it or not. 

Text strings discovered by 9to5Mac in iOS 18.4 beta 3 include a dire warning for those still using the older Home framework: “Support for your current version of Apple Home will end soon. Update now to avoid interruptions with your accessories and automations.” 

Apple hasn’t formally announced that it will end s
title: Still using Apple’s old Home architecture? Get ready for a big change

description:
We love how slim and light laptops are nowadays, but that comes with a drawback: fewer and fewer ports, which can make things difficult if you have to charge gadgets and plug in peripherals and so on.

Well, this tiny Ugreen 5-in-1 USB-C hub is only $10 right now and can definitely help with that situation. This is a 38% discount on a practical accessory that every laptop owner will find useful in some way.

So, what does the Ugreen hub do? It plugs into your laptop’s USB-C port and turns it into five ports: a USB-C with 100W of power delivery, a full-sized HDMI with 4K support, a 5Gbps USB-A port, and two slower 480Mbps USB-A ports. That’s pretty darn good for the price.

And it’s tiny, which means it’s super portable. Whether you need
title: Turn 1 laptop port into 5 (including 4K HDMI) with this $10 gadget

description:
AMD’s new Ryzen 9 9950X3D and 9900X3D are coming this week, but the 9800X3D from last year remains the hottest CPU in town if you’re building a gaming CPU. It’s so hot that YouTube channel Hardware Busters wanted to get a second one for testing. They bought one on Amazon… and got one of the most brazenly fake PC parts I’ve ever seen.

The short video is worth a watch (below) if you’re looking for a chuckle. But if you need a quick summary, the scammer printed a fake 9800X3D label sticker and slapped it onto another CPU. And not just another AM5 CPU, as we’ve seen with
title: Here’s the wildest fake CPU I’ve ever seen — and it was sold on Amazon

description:
TL;DR: Play thousands of classic games on the Kinhank Super Console, on sale for $89.97 until March 30 at 11:59 p.m. PT. 

Gaming is an expensive hobby, but
title: The best thing about PC gaming is finally comes to consoles
